## Question 2

Creating the one-sample t-test function.
```{r}
one_ttest_fx = function(mu) {
  
      x = rnorm(n, mean = mu, sd = sigma)
      
      broom::tidy(t.test(x, mu = 0)) |> 
      dplyr::select(estimate, p.value)

}
```

Generate 5,000 datasets using function. Simulated this for mu = 0:6. Rejection of null hypothesis if p-value > Î± = 0.05.

```{r}
results_df =
  expand_grid(
    mu = mu_value, 
    iter = 1:5000) |>
  mutate(
    test_results = map(mu, one_ttest_fx)
    ) |>
  unnest(test_results) |>
  mutate(
    reject = p.value < 0.05
    )
```

Total number of observations in `results_df` is 35,000.
